summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeSustainable PackagingGive BackYour skin‚Äôs new drink of choice, Farmacy's nourishing Honey Milk Hydrating Essence instantly drenches skin in honey hydration as it comforts and calms visible signs of redness. Hawaiian white honey and chamomile soothe, while ceramides strengthen your skin's moisture barrier.
details: DetailsBenefitsDelivers all-day hydrationPreps skin for makeupNourishes and strengthens the skin‚Äôs moisture barrier with ceramides for lasting hydrationUse Honey Milk Hydrating Essence as a prep for the rest of your skincare routine, or layer it underneath makeup for an extra-glowy, dewy base!Key IngredientsHawaiian White Honey: Rich in antioxidants to help heal and nurture dry, irritated skinChamomile: Calms and soothes redness with immediate comfortResearch Results97% of testers agreed skin felt instantly soothedBased on a consumer panel of 32 subjects after 7 daysItem 2635155How To UseAfter cleansing, apply to face AM and PM by pouring onto palms and pressing into skinFollow with your serum and moisturizerAvoid contact with eyesIngredientsAloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Saccharomyces Ferment Filtrate, Propanediol, Betaine, Isopentyldiol, Water/Aqua/Eau,Glycerin, 1,2-Hexanediol,Honey Extract/ Mel/ Extrait Demiel, Ceramide Np, Anthemis Nobilis Flower Extract, Panthenol, Squalane, Opuntia Ficus-Indica Stem Extract, Arginine, Polyacrylate Crosspolymer-6,Polyglyceryl-10 Stearate, Glucomannan, Sodium Benzoate, Potassium Sorbate, Citric Acid, Sodium Phytate, Hydroxyacetophenone, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Sucrose Stearate, Caprylyl Glycol, Maltodextrin.The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details

reviews.headline: Excellent - a RUN to buy!
reviews.comments: After being truly blown away by the wake up eye cream, I opted to try the honey milk foe a bit or extra moisture. My first bottle was purchased in the summer and helped immensely on days when i had too much sun by restoring my skin. After noticinf how well the product worked, I purchased a second bottle to take me into the winter and (hopefully) assist with sessonal eczema. Using this 1-2x a day, I haven't had a whisper of eczema on my face nor hands! This stuff is the REAL DEAL! An absolute staple in my daily skincare forever!

I do think in this case, you get what you pay for and it's well worth it. I'm 43 and on the drier side as I age (especially in the cold winter months). My skin drank this stuff and wants more! Purchased on my own, not gifted by Farmacy :)

This essence has calmed my skin and significantly reduced my redness. I have added it into my daily morning skincare routine after cleansing. I definitely recommend this essence!

reviews.headline: Love this
reviews.comments: I absolutely love using this hydrating essence, this was gifted by farmacybeauty. A honey-infused milky essence that hydrates to strengthen skin's moisture barrier + soothe dry skin. The formula is very gentle and helps to hydrated the skin from within. My skin was soft, supple and hydrated.

media.headline: It feels so rich and is hydrating
media.caption: Farmacy Essence

faceoff_positive.comments:
I was gifted by Farmacybeauty in exchange for an honest review, but this is actually my second bottle. I've already used up an entire Honey Milk from when it first was released.

They've made some changes since then---the label on the bottle is now transparent instead of white, which is a nice plus because you can actually see how much is left! The glass bottle and the white plastic cap feel a little bit lighter/cheaper IMO, but not significantly so. The little plastic drip mechanism in the top seems to be about the same as before or maybe a bit better, not sure if it is actually slightly easier than before or if I'm just used to it at this point.

That said, the drip mechanism is still the worst part of the product. I guess as a positive it's literally impossible to spill it without breaking the bottle, but it's a bit annoying that you can't just pour a small amount into your hands, you have to tap each single drop out against your finger/hand/cotton round. You could pull the whole plastic component out of the glass bottle but then the opening is pretty large, so it's not the best alternative.

Beyond that, it's a lovely product. It's not super hydrating on its own to me but it helps a lot with calming irritated or inflamed skin. It helps clear up redness from irritation and seems to help my skin recover faster when I've overdone it on actives (although it does sting a touch when going on in that case). It seems to help serums soak in to my skin a bit better and I like layering it underneath my tret (letting the Honey Milk dry first before applying the tret) to help prevent skin peeling/flaking.

The bottle lasts a good while too. I think I got about 7-8 months of daily use out of my first one, so the value is pretty great!

No issue with breakouts from this one despite acne prone skin, and I don't think it has any added fragrance but you can definitely smell the honey and chamomile. The texture really is quite similar to a thin milk, not so runny it'll drip through your hands (I just tap it into my fingers to apply to my face) but just before that in viscosity
faceoff_positive.headline: Great calming toner

faceoff_negative.comments: I had high hopes for the Farmacy Honey Milk Hydrating Essence after hearing great things, and was excited to be receive this product gifted by Farmacy in exchange for my review, but so far it hasn't provided the results I was expecting. The texture feels nice when I apply the product, but it just doesn't provide much hydration. I've tried using it on both dry and damp skin, as well as layering it, but my skin still doesn't feel very hydrated. On top of that, the bottle design is frustrating‚ÄîI find it difficult to get a sufficient amount of product out since it comes out just one drop at a time. A few pros are that it doesn't irritate my skin and doesn't have any overbearing scent. While I plan to keep using it to see if things improve, it's been a disappointment given the hype.
faceoff_negative.headline: Not as hydrating as expected, difficult to get product out
